memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2432

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the public authorities law, in relation to discontinuing the
New Rochelle toll plaza on the New England section of the New York state
thruway

PURPOSE:
The purpose of the bill is to eliminate the toll plaza on the New
England section of the New York State Thruway. Daily commuters from
Westchester, the Bronx and Manhattan pay a disproportionate fee to
use this section of the Thruway, compared to every other corridor
across the state.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Section 1 of this bill adds a new section 354-a of the public
authorities law to authorize the discontinuance and elimination of
the New Rochelle toil plaza as identified.

JUSTIFICATION:
The New Rochelle toll plaza on the New England section of the New York
State Thruway is located in a densely populated corridor where the
City of New Rochelle, Village of Larchmont and Town of Mamaroneck
meet. As such, there are serious issues of air pollution and noise
pollution that are generated for area residents by the presence of
this toll plaza. Further, the presence of this toil plaza serves to
direct northbound traffic onto local roads, particularly U. S. I
(Boston Post Road), through the developed corridors of New Rochelle,
Larchmont and Mamaroneck, adding to local congestion and air pollution.

As a matter of parity, New York State residents in the Buffalo,
Rochester, Syracuse, Utica, Schenectady-Albany and Yonkers areas have
sought to reduce the financial burdens on daily, local commuters who
travel between exits of the main branch of the Thruway. The same
relief should apply to commuters who face the $1.00 toll for trips as
short as two miles between exits.

An act to eliminate the Yonkers toll plaza - patterned on the
elimination of the Spring Valley toll plaza - has received
legislative consideration for the same reasons.

01/06/10 REFERRED TO TRANSPORTATION

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
To be determined.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect sixty (60) days after adoption.
